column4: if for example I want to know which version of python-wxgtk that is installed on my system, how can I check?

Hello again everyone! I'm wondering, Ubuntu has Firefox 1.0.7 installed by default, if I want to upgrade to 1.5 RC2, what should I do, just download it and manually install it or somehow through the Package Manager?
firefox rc2 is out or rc1?
rc2 is out
nothing big, just some fixes to the automatic update system (atleast thats what the release notes say)
cool, thanks
I cannot wait for firefox 1.5 final to go on Ubuntu... its faster...

np, could you help me out? I've downloaded the firefox-1.5rc2.tar.gz and it automaticly opened it in something called fileroller which seems to be like winrar for windows, should I just copy it over the old firefox folder?
check Ubuntu forums... walkthrough already there for firefox 1.5
oh, ok =) thanks
which of the forums should I search in?
I believe it is in the Ubuntu howto forums... search for firefox 1.5
the walkthrough works, I did it and had no problems!
when, firefox 1.5 is released will I be able to update it through the Synaptic Package Manager then?
Firefox has it;s own update feature... I currently downgraded and cant wait for it :)

yeah I know but I looked at the walkthrough and it's not as easy for me as it sounds on the text, for example how to install mozilla-mplayer, I can't find it in the package manager, and also they say I need libstdc++5 but I've got 6, do I still need 5 or is 6 a later version?
oh, but what about the libstdc++5? :P
I followed the tute a while ago, it worked perfect and let me test Firefox 1.5 for a bit... then I just downgraded... I can wait and don't wish to break Ubuntu or something :)
so your waiting untill it's up in the Package Manager?
sure, its no big deal and doesn't intriduce features which are too die for or anything :)
yeah thats what I was asking before if it was going to add to their for easy update when 1.5 was released :)
excuse my horrible english :)

when the official 1.5 is released... if Ubuntu doesn't up to it in time I might go ahead and install otherwise waiting will be no big deal... The one really cool thing about the new Firefox is how popups and javascript windows can be forced into a tab instead which is really nice...
yeah okey then I'll just hope they'll add it when it comes :)
